description: Microsoft Emotion API allows you to build more personalized apps with Microsoft’s cutting edge cloud-based emotion recognition algorithm.

blocks.name: getEmotionRecognition
blocks.description: Recognizes the emotions expressed by one or more people in an image, as well as returns a bounding box for the face. The emotions detected are happiness, sadness, surprise, anger, fear, contempt, and disgust or neutral.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: Required: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

blocks.name: getEmotionRecognitionInVideo
blocks.description: Method recognizes the emotions expressed by the people in an image and returns their emotions. Currently support videos under 1MB.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: Required: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: outputStyle
args.info: Optional: Defaults to “aggregate” style, but a user can specify “perFrame” style.

blocks.name: getEmotionRecognitionWithFaceRectangles
blocks.description: Recognizes the emotions expressed by one or more people in an image, as well as returns a bounding box for the face.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: Required: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: faceRectangles
args.info: Optional: A face rectangle is in the form “left,top,width,height”. Delimited multiple face rectangles with a “;”.

blocks.name: getVideoRecognitionStatus
blocks.description: Get recognition in Video operation result.

args.name: subscriptionKey
args.info: Required: The api key obtained from Microsoft Cognitive Servisces.

args.name: objectId
args.info: Required: The ID of the uploaded video for recognizing.
